findings.title: Column "email" in table "users" is nullable
findings.evidence: Column "email" in table "users" has nullable: true. This may cause data integrity issues.
findings.recommendation: Set nullable: false for column "email" in table "users" to ensure data integrity.

findings.title: Table "posts" has no primary key
findings.evidence: Table posts has 3 columns but no primary key defined.
findings.recommendation: Add a primary key column (e.g., "id" with integer type and primaryKey: true) to table "posts".

findings.title: Column "title" in table "posts" is nullable
findings.evidence: Column "title" in table "posts" has nullable: true. This may cause data integrity issues.
findings.recommendation: Set nullable: false for column "title" in table "posts" to ensure data integrity.

findings.title: Column "user_id" in table "posts" lacks foreign key
findings.evidence: Column "user_id" in table "posts" ends with "_id" but has no foreignKey relationship defined.
findings.recommendation: Add a foreignKey relationship to column "user_id" pointing to the referenced table and column.

findings.title: Foreign key in "comments.post_id" points to non-existent table
findings.evidence: Column "post_id" references table "post" which does not exist in the schema.
findings.recommendation: Either create the missing table "post" or fix the foreignKey reference.

findings.title: Write endpoint "POST /users" has no authentication
findings.evidence: Endpoint POST /users allows write operations without authentication (requiresAuth: false).
findings.recommendation: Set requiresAuth: true for endpoint POST /users to prevent unauthorized data modification.

findings.title: Endpoint "GET /users" requires auth but has no allowed roles
findings.evidence: Endpoint GET /users has requiresAuth: true but rolesAllowed is empty. No users can access this endpoint.
findings.recommendation: Add appropriate roles to rolesAllowed (e.g., ["user", "admin"]) for endpoint GET /users.

findings.title: DELETE endpoint "/users" allows "user" role
findings.evidence: Endpoint DELETE /users allows users with "user" role to delete resources. This may be overly permissive.
findings.recommendation: Consider restricting DELETE operations on "/users" to "admin" role only.

findings.title: Destructive function "cleanup_old_data" lacks admin protection
findings.evidence: Function "cleanup_old_data" has isDestructive: true but no auth rules mention "admin" role.
findings.recommendation: Add auth rules that require "admin" role before executing destructive function "cleanup_old_data".
